messages.message:
Hey, I'm seeing some issues with the manage datasets section of 'Accuracy tests'. Behaviour I'm seeing:
1. I can't delete datasets - if I run into issues with my app run and update the app, I might want to alter my dataset to include some new edge cases
2. I updated my app with a patch change and I'm not prompted to re-run my datasets that are outdated. What is the criteria for this to happen?
    a. I updated the prompt and changed the model for one of my extractions, then updated the app with a patch

1. It’s not possible to delete ground truth sets right now
2. Can you take a screenshot of the ground truth sets table? You are correct that you should see an “Outdated” status for your ground truth sets
Now I went to change a value in a table and got these errors. When I backed out of the edit screen I see this

Here is a recording of the issue. The delete rows functionality is also blocked out.

What if I want to change the type of the output from e.g. text -> table or vice-versa? Can I do that?

ah the “Review required” status takes precedence over the “Outdated” status

we do this because
1. you need to mark all documents as reviewed in your ground truth set before you can use it to run an accuracy test
2. however, you can run an accuracy test with an “Outdated” ground truth set in 24.42 (see release notes (https://instabase-staging.docs.buildwithfern.com/release-notes))

based on this screenshot (https://instabase.slack.com/files/U06G3LGDBQU/F07U416MQE8/image.png), it seems that in Human Review, we don’t handle the case where the table cell is empty?

cc @Udit

> What if I want to change the type of the output from e.g. text -> table or vice-versa? Can I do that?
there’s no way to do this right now in Human Review :disappointed: CMIIW @Udit
